intro: Thyrocarpus fulvescens, commonly known as the golden thorny tree, is a shrub or small tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes plants such as cashew and poison ivy. The plant is characterized by its thorny stems and small, yellowish-green leaves. Its flowers are typically clustered and produce small, fleshy fruits that are orange to red in color. The plant is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing features that help it conserve water and thrive in harsh conditions.
